meanings.sent1: His brashnesses in class often got him in trouble with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her brashnesses at the party offended many guests.
meanings.sent3: Despite his brashnesses, he somehow managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her brashnesses were like a loud alarm clock, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The brashnesses of the toddler made everyone in the room burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: The quality of being bold or audacious
meanings.sent1: The politician's brashnesses in his speeches captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: She admired his brashnesses in taking risks and pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent3: The brashnesses of the squirrel trying to steal from the bird feeder was both daring and comical.
meanings.sent4: His brashnesses shone like a beacon of courage in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The brashnesses of the explorer led to incredible discoveries in unknown lands.
